content:
I'm glad you're considering trying out new classes! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have real-time access to specific gym schedules or offerings. But I can guide you on how to find out if the gym near your work offers spin classes and what their schedule looks like.

Here's what you can do:

1. **Check the gym's website**: Visit the gym's website and look for a "Group Fitness" or "Class Schedule" section. They might have a drop-down menu or a separate page listing their class offerings.
2. **Use the gym's mobile app**: If the gym has a mobile app, download it and check the class schedule section. Many gyms offer digital schedules and booking systems through their apps.
3. **Call the gym directly**: Reach out to the gym's front desk or customer service and ask if they offer spin classes. They can provide you with the schedule and any additional information you might need.
4. **Check social media or online directories**: Look up the gym's social media profiles (e.g., Facebook, Instagram) or online directories like ClassPass or MindBody to see if they advertise spin classes or have a schedule posted.

Once you find the schedule, you can plan your visit and book a class that fits your schedule. Some gyms might offer introductory sessions or workshops, which can be a great way to try out spin classes for the first time.

As for boot camp classes, you can follow the same steps to find out if the gym offers them and what the schedule looks like.

Remember to arrive a few minutes early to your first class, and don't hesitate to ask the instructor or gym staff any questions you might have. They'll be happy to help you get started with spin or boot camp classes!

Spin classes can be an excellent way to challenge yourself and improve your cardiovascular endurance, while boot camp classes can help you build strength and agility. Whichever class you choose, make sure to listen to your body and pace yourself accordingly. Most importantly, have fun and enjoy the challenge!
